StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveShipperMissingDocuments]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @ID uniqueiden..er, @ShipperID int, @Big3 varchar(200), @Package varchar(200), @Dependents varchar(200), @Other varchar(200), @DateCreated date.me, @DateContactedRS date.me, @InterviewerID int, @LastEditBy varchar(200) ) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT ID FROM [USMC].Shipper_MissingDocuments WHERE [ID] = @ID) BEGIN UPDATE [USMC].[Shipper_MissingDocuments] SET [ShipperID] = @ShipperID, [Big3] = @Big3, [Package] = @Package, [Dependents] = @Dependents, [Other] = @Other, [DateCreated] = @DateCreated, [DateContactedRS] = @DateContactedRS, [InterviewerID] = @InterviewerID WHERE [ID] = @ID END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [USMC].[Shipper_MissingDocuments] ( [ID], [ShipperID], [Big3], [Package], [Dependents], [Other], [DateCreated], [DateContactedRS], [InterviewerID] ) VALUES ( @ID, @ShipperID, @Big3, @Package, @Dependents, @Other, @DateCreated, @DateContactedRS, @InterviewerID )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
